subject: Personal Finance
title: Peer Pressure Spending
description: Learn Peer Pressure Spending in one minute.

hook.text: Your friends suggest an expensive dinner. You can't afford it, but you say yes anyway.

buildup.text: Peer spending pressure is the subtle force matching our financial habits to our friends'.

discovery.text: Your spending patterns closely mirror the five people you spend the most time with.

twist.text: It works both ways. Frugal friends make you frugal. Big spenders pull you along.

climax.text: Saying no to a social expense feels like rejecting the group, which our brains hate.

punchline.text: Your budget reflects your social circle.

quiz.question: How do friends influence your spending?
options: Your spending mirrors the people closest to you
Friends have no effect on finances
